notes: Working titles included The Ark and Ark in Space.
The Nerva sets are reused for 'Revenge of the Cybermen'.
Only regular cast appears on-screen in part one, since the first season.
Vira's role was originally written to be black and possibly Haitian.
Lucarotti's original script had different alien race and motivations.
Ending revised to avoid fright for younger audiences.

in_universe_mythology: Space-borne species Wirrn, assimilating human knowledge.

continuity_notes: Story is set in a sequence aboard Space Station Nerva, continued through The Sontaran Experiment and Genesis of the Daleks.
The Wirrn and Nerva are part of a significant wider story arc.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS lands on an apparently deserted Earth space station in the future. Thousands of humans are in cryogenic sleep and an insectoid alien race, the Wirrn, threaten their survival. The Doctor and his companions must overcome various obstacles and plan to save both the humans and the station.

An alien infiltrates and the TARDIS crew is trapped on the station. Discovering the sleeping humans and being attacked by an automatic system, they witness Sarah being taken into suspension while fighting for their survival.

One of the crew, Vira, revives and explains the situation. The Doctor repairs the station infrastructure but finds himself at odds with Noah, a reviving crew member touched and semi-controlled by a Wirrn grub.

The Doctor and others attempt to stall Wirrn attacks as they prepare the station to repel them. Noah, now almost fully transformed, fights to retain his humanity, leading to his sacrifice to save his fellow humans.
